revised_title: Re-Examining the Southern Portion of the Great Indian Arc of Meridian
tldr: In 1860, Sir George Everest proposed to the Royal Society of London to re-examine the southern portion of the Great Indian Arc of the Meridian, which was surveyed by Colonel Lambton. He suggested that the results of the survey should be collated and combined into one volume for better data management. The Royal Society appointed a committee to consider and report on the subject, and they recommended revising and recomputing the calculations of the sides of the triangles and verifying the printed calculations.
